newsitem.title: USA: McAfee, RSA set data anti-virus framework.
newsitem.headline: McAfee, RSA set data anti-virus framework.

text.p: McAfee Associates said it has reached agreement with Security Dynamics Technologies Inc, RSA Data Security Inc and Verisign Inc to form a computer network security framework.
Executives of McAfee and its partners said in a conference call the agreement allows customers to combine products more easily into building more secure computer networks.

The framework, dubbed SecureONE, is geared to link anti-virus, authentication, encryption and digital certificate products and technologies which ensures the partners' products will work well together, they said.
Jim Bidzos, chief executive of RSA, a unit of Security Dynamics, told the teleconference that RSA will deliver a jointly developed set of programming interfaces in its RSA toolkits.
Bidzos noted that RSA's technology is available on products which reach some 100 million computers, including Internet browsers distributed by Netscape Communications Corp and Microsoft Corp.

McAfee separately announced a toolkit dubbed the Virus Interface for Protective Early Response, or VIPER, which can be used by independent and corporate software developers to link their computer programs to McAfee's Viruscan software.
VIPER will be the virus protection interface for the SecureONE framework, the companies said.

Bidzos said the agreement top threats to computer network security, as identified by a recent Ernst and Young study as virus attacks, sabotage from outside a company's network, such as across the Internet, and sabotage from within companies.
Bidzos said the combination of virus scanning and digital signatures "fit together hand in glove," and authentification and encryption technologies further enhances the toolkit.
Shares of McAfee rose 2-1/2 to 62-1/2 by early afternoon.

McAfee stock had tumbled by 28 percent from 77-1/4 in the last week to close at 60 Monday on concerns over lengthening customer payment times, competition in its anti-virus market and a lawsuit brought by rival Symantec.
Shares of Security Dynamics gained 1-1/8 to 38-1/4.

Verisign is a privately held company spun out of RSA which offers certificates that are the digital world's equivalent of signatures in the physical world. Reuters Holdings Plc holds a small stake in Verisign.
